summary: William K Triplett is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list Triplett's name, position, and salary during these periods. The specific role or responsibilities of Triplett within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation.
significance: William K Triplett's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these payroll documents, his presence indicates he was part of the team involved in the investigation into the JFK assassination.
